description: In Elon’s 100-Day Bet, Bloomberg Originals explores what the Tesla CEO leaves behind now that he says he’s stepping back from the Trump administration.
title: What Musk’s 100 Days Mean for America

description: When President Donald Trump in March ordered the immediate deportation of potentially thousands of alleged Venezuelan gang members to an El Salvador mega-prison, he did so by invoking a controversial 227-year-old US law intended for use in times of war.
title: Why a Judge Rejected Trump’s Use of the Alien Enemies Act

description: A lawyer for a former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. banker told a federal judge that he has asked the US to drop its foreign bribery case, citing an executive order from President Donald Trump.
title: Ex-Goldman Sachs Banker Asks US to Drop Foreign Bribery Case

description: The Trump administration asked the US Supreme Court for clearance to end legal protections that let 350,000 Venezuelans temporarily live and work in the country without risk of deportation.
title: Noem Asks Supreme Court to Allow Lifting of Migrant Protections

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson outlines where things stand with the Republican tax cut plan. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Republicans Grind Out Details on Medicaid, SALT in Trump Tax Cut Plan

description: The Trump administration sees its resource deal with Ukraine as a model for further international agreements, reflecting the president’s strategy of using Washington’s foreign policy heft to secure assets and investment returns overseas.
title: Trump Team Sees Ukraine Pact as Model for Future Foreign Deals

description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro presented a bill on Thursday that seeks to submit proposals for labor rights and working conditions to a public referendum after Congress rejected his labor reform earlier this year.
title: Colombia’s Petro Presents Bill to Submit Labor Law to Referendum

description: Leaders of major West Coast ports warned that a sharp drop in ship traffic tied to President Donald Trump’s steep tariffs on Chinese goods will threaten jobs, raise prices and ripple through the broader US economy.
title: Port Leaders Warn Tariffs Bring ‘Radical Uncertainty’ to Economy

description: The bank’s board voted to repeal the 12-year-old restrictions in a move decried by environmentalists.
title: US Export-Import Bank Lifts Curbs on Coal Plant Loans After Trump Order

description: New York Mayor Eric Adams proposed a revised $115.1 budget that adds more than $1.4 billion in new spending for programs including early childhood education, even as potential cuts in federal funding loom.
title: New York’s Adams Pitches $115 Billion Budget as Trump Cuts Loom

description: President Donald Trump has called for the US to retake control of the Panama Canal unless the cost of passage for American naval and merchant ships is slashed or even eliminated. Trump’s refusal to rule out the use of force is a throwback to the 19th century era of gunboat diplomacy. While it remains unclear whether Trump is simply posturing, his demand has jolted Latin America, which is less afflicted by territorial disputes than regions such as the Middle East and Asia. It shows a willingness
title: Trump Wants to ‘Take Back’ the Panama Canal. Why That’s Not So Simple

description: Elon Musk has his sights set on the Federal Reserve, suggesting that his government-efficiency team should examine the nation’s central bank.
title: Is the Federal Reserve Headed for a Showdown with DOGE?

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth wants the Army to shed outdated weapons and vehicles and increase its use of drones as part of a broad overhaul of the military’s largest service.
title: Hegseth Wants Streamlined Army Focused on Advanced Weapons

description: The president generates a lot of news. You’re forgiven if any of the following stories escaped your attention.
title: 100 Moments You Might Have Missed From Trump’s First 100 Days

description: Nuclear talks between the US and Iran are facing fresh uncertainty after a meeting set to take place this weekend was postponed and US officials said they had never agreed to join the latest round in the first place.
title: US-Iran Talks Hit Snag as Oman Says Next Round Is Postponed

description: Key House Republicans on Thursday discussed ways to direct an expanded state and local tax deduction to those making less than $400,000 as they seek to balance the cost of the tax break with the political needs of several lawmakers from New York and other high-tax states.
title: SALT Talks Stall as GOP Mulls Limiting Tax Break to Middle Class

description: The US Energy Department delayed a key report on natural gas minutes before it was scheduled to be published Thursday, fueling concern that Elon Musk’s cost-cutting efforts will disrupt data closely watched by companies and traders.
title: Key US Gas Report Is Late as DOGE Concerns Dog Energy Agency

description: A federal judge in Texas ruled that President Donald Trump improperly invoked a 227-year-old wartime law to deport accused Venezuelan gang members to an El Salvador prison, setting up what may become yet another high-stakes battle at the US Supreme Court.
title: Judge Bars Trump’s Use of Wartime Law to Deport Venezuelans

description: National Security Advisor Michael Waltz is leaving his post, people familiar with the matter said, a stunning fall for one of President Donald Trump’s top aides.
title: National Security Advisor Waltz to Depart After Chat Controversy

description: Republicans moved a step closer Thursday to repealing a federal waiver allowing California to ban gasoline-powered cars by 2035, a policy that had drawn opposition from automakers, fuel producers and President Donald Trump himself.
title: California’s Ban on Gasoline Cars Is Overturned by US House Vote

description: President Donald Trump and House Republicans are slated to meet to wrangle over one of the thorniest issues dividing the party: whether to cut Medicaid benefits for millions of low-income Americans.
title: Trump, House GOP Meet to Discuss Whether to Cut Medicaid for Millions of Americans

description: South Korea’s Finance Minister Choi Sang-mok resigned less than two hours before he was due to become the nation’s stand-in leader, in another shock development that deepens the country’s political crisis.
title: South Korea’s Finance Minister Quits as Political Crisis Deepens

description: A spiritual leader of Syria’s Druze minority called on international forces to protect his community from the new government after a wave of violence left dozens of people dead.
title: Syrian Minority Leader Calls for Foreign Help as Violence Mounts

description: AIB Group Plc shareholders voted to buy back €1.2 billion ($1.4 billion) worth of shares from the Irish state, putting the lender on the verge of full private ownership.
title: AIB Shareholders Approve €1.2 Billion Irish State Buyback Plan

description: President Donald Trump has started vacillating between telling Americans to be patient in the face of bad economic news and blaming his predecessor for it, leaving him vulnerable to losing the support of voters who elected him to improve the nation’s economy.
title: Trump Blames Biden for Bad News But It’s His Tariff Economy

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said that the US Treasury market is sending a signal that the Federal Reserve ought to lower interest rates.
title: Bessent Says Two-Year Treasuries Are Signaling Fed Should Cut

description: After months of bad-tempered exchanges and a bust-up on live TV at the White House, the Trump administration finally struck an agreement with Ukraine that grants the US privileged access to the embattled country’s natural resources, including aluminum, graphite, oil and natural gas.
title: What the US and Ukraine Get With Trump’s Minerals Deal

description: Trump’s minerals deal no longer looks like the colonial outrage it was.
title: Maybe Zelenskiy Should Be Writing the Art of the Deal

description: The increase in long-distance transfers makes it harder to fight deportation and boosts taxpayer expense.
title: The Rising Cost of ICE Flying Immigrants to Far-Flung Detention Centers

description: Romanians will head to the polls on Sunday in a high-stakes rerun of the country’s presidential election, almost six months after the country’s top court invalidated the original vote over allegations of Russian interference.
title: How Romania’s Election Descended Into Chaos, and What’s Next

description: Thai prosecutors dismissed charges against an American academic accused of insulting the country’s monarchy, after his arrest was criticized by the US and cast a shadow over tariff talks.
title: Thai Prosecutors Drop Royal Insult Case Against US Academic

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: It’s Time for Merz to Make Germany Great Again

description: Billionaire Elon Musk said he is considering sending his government efficiency team to the Federal Reserve, citing a costly renovation of the central bank’s Washington, DC, headquarters as an example of potential government waste.
title: Musk Says DOGE ‘Should Definitely’ Examine Federal Reserve Costs

description: He’s slept in the Lincoln Bedroom, raided a White House freezer for Haagen-Dazs ice cream and played video games from his West Wing office.
title: West Wing Video Games, Ice Cream Raids: Musk’s 100 Days of DOGE

description: Rachel Reeves is under investigation by the UK parliament’s standards watchdog for declaring a gift late.
title: Reeves Investigated Over Free Tickets to ‘Ballet Shoes’ Show

description: South Korea’s Acting President Han Duck-soo stepped down from his post on Thursday, paving the way for a widely expected announcement of his presidential candidacy.
title: South Korea’s Prime Minister Han Resigns Ahead of Presidential Bid

description: Foreign Minister Subrahmanyam Jaishankar reiterated that “perpetrators, backers and planners” of an attack that killed dozens of people in Indian-controlled Kashmir must be brought to justice, hours after speaking with his US counterpart Marco Rubio who had sought to de-escalate tensions.
title: India Renews Call for ‘Justice’ After Rubio Urges De-Escalation

description: South Korea’s top court ruled that presidential candidate Lee Jae-myung violated election law and sent the case back to the high court for final sentencing.
title: S. Korean Top Court Overturns Lee’s Acquittal, Risking Candidacy

description: Australia’s budget bottom line will be improved by about A$14 billion ($9 billion) over four years under a Liberal-National Coalition government, the opposition’s economic spokespeople said as they unveiled plans to cut the bureaucracy and scrap the Labor government’s tax cuts.
title: Australia’s Opposition Pledges to Improve Budget by $9 Billion

description: Singaporeans will head to the polls on May 3 after a mere nine-day election campaign — among the world’s shortest timelines for voters to make a decision. The ballot comes at a particularly challenging time for the small, open, trade-dependent economy, which could suffer collateral damage in the escalating tariff war between the US and China.
title: Why Singapore’s Election Is a New Test for the Ruling Party

description: Former Vice President Kamala Harris reemerged on the national stage Wednesday, sharply criticizing President Donald Trump for “inviting a recession” with his tariff policies while rallying supporters in her first major speech since leaving the White House.
title: Kamala Harris Sharply Criticizes Trump in First Major Speech Since Inauguration

description: This weekend’s presidential election looks set to expose divisions again, six months after the authorities cancelled the last one.
title: Romania’s Far Right Seeks to Avenge Their Hero in Vote Rerun

description: As tensions build between India and Pakistan over last week’s deadly attack on tourists in Kashmir, the focus is now turning to whether military conflict is a likelihood between the nuclear-armed neighbors.
title: How India and Pakistan’s Military, Nuclear Arsenals Stack Up

description: A key US Senate ally of President Donald Trump said he has the commitment of 72 colleagues for a bill that would enact “bone-crushing” new sanctions on Russia and tariffs on countries that buy its oil, gas and other key products if Vladimir Putin doesn’t engage in serious negotiations to end the war in Ukraine.
title: Graham Says He Has Broad Senate Support for New Russia Sanctions

description: Japan needs to firmly refuse US President Donald Trump’s calls for Tokyo to increase what it pays to keep American military bases in the country, a former Japanese foreign minister said, a day before the second round of talks over tariffs between the allies.
title: Japan Must Refuse Trump’s Military Cost Demand, Ex-Minister Says

description: Venezuela’s Nicolas Maduro raised workers’ minimum wage days before a controversial regional vote, a move that could add pressure on prices as the government grapples with shrinking foreign revenue.
title: Maduro Boosts Wages in Bid to Rally Support Before Regional Vote
